title: Thanks to all staff
body: I just wanted to thank all the staff in A and E for their professionalism and obvious ongoing caring attitude despite the pandemic. I hold them all in the highest regard.

title: Lovely Nurse
body:
Wonderful nurse who helped me a lot once I came out of hospital.  
Very caring and professional who went above and beyond.

title: Amazing 5 * care for day surgery
body:
I attended the gynae day ward for minor surgery today under general anaesthetic. I was very anxious but as soon as I arrived from the ward clerk, domestic, the auxiliary nurses, staff nurses , doctors and anaesthetists who were all so lovely I felt so more at ease. 
All staff showed such care & empathy. 
Being a nurse myself I am aware how hard and busy it can be but they all just worked so well as a team. 
I am home and very comfortable. 
I didnt see a doctor post op but was happy to have a letter sent home as was ready to leave. 
I honestly would have paid for care so good if I had to go private for anything like that. 
Well done all the staff who looked after me. You do a superb job even in these hard time. Thankyou x

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Thank you
body: Lovely, helpful receptionists. Quick telephone appointment offered, then seen face-to-face and thoroughly assessed and referred on. Followed up the following week. Kindness, empathy and professionalism all round. Thank you.

title: Happy with outcome:)
body: Firstly am currently in living in Newton abbot Devon but i sometimes stay in Newquay at my parents caravan :) i visited the accident and emergency (A+E) yesterday 3/11/20 as from writing this comment! The A+E department staff where very helpful and welcoming, i didnt experience any negativity part from all positive :) am happy with the outcome the service was well delivered :) so many thankyou A+E@ RCHTüëç

title: A huge" thank you"!
body: My review is about an operation that I had at Marytime Hospital about 6 weeks ago,I have been referred  for a total thyroidectomy surgery and my diagnosis was a Multi Modular goitre which was causing significant compression of trachea and also difficulties in breathing.  I have to say a big "thank you" to all staff,,starting from the Locum Ent Consulant( the surgeon doctor) who has gone through all this procedure with me  from the beginning, explained  patiently and exactly everything about surgery , reassuring me with the appropriate knowledge ,,but I'm also grateful to all nursing  staff present that day,, and to all the staff who attended to me at Arethusa Ward after the surgery!! I know we are living at difficult times at present days and I'm able to understand that I was  very lucky to have the surgery done at Marytime Hospital and for that I will be always grateful!!!

title: Amazingly quick service
body: I was very impressed with how quickly we received a response and were seen. Our usual GP practice practice on westbury Avenue referred us to a GP here and within 30 minutes I received a video call back for my son by a very kind and helpful GP who then made time for an in person appointment straight away. The turn around was so quick and a very helpful and kind GP. Thank you.

title: Best Surgery with amazing staff
body: Myself and my family have been using the surgery for six years and I can honestly say we have never experienced a more professional, hard working and happy team of healthcare professionals. I have spoken to district nurses whom agree that they are the best surgery to be under as a patient. When I moved my father in with us for a period time, they could not have done more for him with his complex needs even though he was only with us for six weeks. Even during lockdown all staff have been totally amazing and never feel rushed on telephone calls. Very lucky to have this surgery in our village. Thank you!

title: Great Service
body: I called the Practice and although I had to wait to get through, once I had spoken to the Receptionist, she handled my call efficiently and in a friendly manner. Thereafter a Triage Nurse called me promptly, discussed my case and arranged for a prescription to be sent to the Pharmacy, which was delivered to me the same afternoon. All in all a great service!

title: Am leaving the practice after just 2 weeks - not‚Ä¶
body: A GP that I spoke to last week was very nice and helpful. I had to speak to a different GP this week and he was rude, too abrupt and even told me that he did not have the time for me. This was upsetting as I was really suffering and had struggled and waited 2 days for the phone appointment. I only joined the practice 2 weeks ago and I am already leaving. I will go and find a GP that does take an interest in their patients.

title: Great practice
body:
Very professional 
Friendly and helpful reception staff
Doctor made me feel at ease , answered any questions I had in detail

title: Good service
body: The service from Highcliffe Medical Centre since I became a patient there  earlier this year has been really good. My initial new patient/medication assessment was very thorough & a GP dealt promptly with my recent request for repeat medication that had not been prescribed for 2 years. My mother has also been visited several times by the District Nursing Team & Rehabilitation staff who have also provided an excellent service. Thank you to all concerned.

title: Review
body: It‚Äôs no better than anywhere else! Very defensive if you don‚Äôt accept what they say , which is generally ‚Äúeverything is fine , no further action ‚Äú . Seems to be a universal nhs line. Nice new practice ,the doctors I‚Äôve experienced are pleasant, bar one , but their hands are tied so there‚Äôs not much they can do . It‚Äôs becoming apparent  we all NEED private cover .

author: ADissapointedServiceUser
title: Variable treatment depending on who you meet!
body:
I have a long standing mental health condition which led to me being hospitalised. The treatment I received from the team at woodland view was excellent, particularly from the OT there.  
Unfortunately, the treatment I‚Äôve received in the community from psychology has been disappointing, constantly made to feel like I was a time Waster and a burden, and ultimately discharged effectively for ‚Äúnot trying hard enough‚Äù, despite turning up to appointments and doing homework between sessions. I‚Äôm afraid I can‚Äôt help it if the treatment isn‚Äôt working for me, but I‚Äôve been made to feel like it‚Äôs my fault I‚Äôm not recovered. I‚Äôve found the nursing and medical staff are great, but psychology seems to be a different story unfortunately.  
I‚Äôve heard this sort of thing from other patients too, so I suspect I‚Äôm not an isolated case. Seems to be a culture of get people out the door (or don‚Äôt let them through until the first place!) if you don‚Äôt fit a pretty narrow set of criteria .

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Very reassuring and efficient
body: Had my smear test on 4th November 2020.  All done efficiently with minimal discomfort.  The lovely nurse who carried out the test was also very reassuring with the way she explained the COVID-19 precautions being taken currently.  I felt very comfortable having this procedure done today.  Thankyou!

author: apusbd75
title: Help after son's suicide.
body:
I feel devastated and traumatised. Tremendous loss and overwhelming sense of guilt. I have complex grief now and will always carry it with me. I wish I could turn the clock back but know thats impossible.  
I lost my son in July this year to suicide. He was 18 years old. It was totally unexpected .  
Since loosing him, I have been offered very little in terms of support from the local IAPT team. I have had one telephone consultation appointment which I had to fight to get. Then I was offered nothing until later down the line perhaps? This feels like an appalling service and especially at a time when parents themselves are very much at risk of doing the same thing as their child due to what‚Äôs going on inside their heads to.  
I have had support from the suicide bereavement services and they have managed to secure me some counselling with a local charity, which I am enormously grateful for. Especially the bereavement practitioner from the service who rang me up regularly and offered me a listening ear. I cant tell you how much that meant to me.  
Four and a half months later I have still heard nothing from the IAPT service, In my opinion, in my experience they fail people and are not fit for purpose.

author: upsetdaughter
title: Mum being taken to emergency department
body:
mum was taken to st Mary's by ambulance at around 4pm. She had been bleeding profusely from her stoma. The paramedics were brilliant dealing with all the blood and feaces it looked like a crimes scene when I arrived. It was all extremely distressing not only for mum but my father as well.  
I rang the ed department at 5. 30 for my father who by now was thinking the worst to be told they were just assessing her. I rang again at 7. 30 and was initially told they couldn't tell me anything over the phone! I explained the situation and eventually someone else came onto phone but no one gave their names or even their title. This person went to talk to mum apparently and came back giving me a password I was to use when they had transferred her to the ward but still not giving any real information.  
Again at 8. 45 was told the same thing. We have now had no information for over 4 hours and the only reason we Know she is alive is that they said she was waiting for a bed! Her husband ( my father) of over 50 years is beside himself. The anxiety and distress caused is unnecessary. We understand why we can't be there but to keep us in the dark is inhumane. If they can set up a password for the ward why can't that system be used by ed.

author: Garden985
title: Endoscopy Unit
body:
In these difficult times it might be understandable for staff to have their focus slightly blurred. However on my experience today this is definitely not the case. Having been referred to endoscopy following an anomaly with a CT scan I was extremely nervous. However the gentleman who carried out the procedure did absolutely everything to allay my nerves. He firstly spent time explaining exactly what he was was going to do and then talked me through everything as it happened. After the procedure he then spent time explaining his findings and how to manage my ongoing condition.  
A difficult time made much easier by a clinician who actually cared.  
Thank you to all the team

author: Angie150
title: Never felt pain like that before!
body:
Having to give up trying to deal with severe pain at home, I was given advice from 111 that I should attend A&E at R.A.H. I was not looking forward to going because of my past experiences but the amount of pain I was in drove the necessity.  
After waiting half an hour to be triaged, once through to a room, everyone I came in contact with was so nice. Even when I was vomiting!  
They were quick to get me to ct scan and after several doses of pain relief it finally was under control.  
The conclusion was a kidney stone that was working its way down. Never felt pain like that before!  
So a huge thank you to the student nurses, nurses, doctors, radiographers etc who helped me. You were all so kind.  
I know you wanted me up on the bed but I was just in too much pain. Sorry.  
Thanks again to all of you.

author: nooneinparticular
title: PEG installation
body:
My mother has a slow progressive illness which causes her to experience swallowing difficulties. Over the years she'd been repeatedly advised that she should have a PEG fitted & avoid eating/drinking. She's been adamant that this wasn't something she wanted. The Royal Free Neurological Rehabilitation Centre repeatedly sent both a dietitian & a SALT to explain the dangers inherent in her continuing to try & eat/drink. The dietitian tried to suggest different menu options to help, but my mother wasn't keen on changing her lifestyle.  
Finally, after she really started to struggle & her weight loss became accelerated, she decided that she'd have to go with the PEG. The dietitian managed to organise that the PEG was put in in the middle of Covid lockdown. She advised on the feeding regime & sorted out the regular supply of feed. My mother has since regained a stone that she'd lost & is doing much better. We're still in shock that it was all organised to happen while hospitals weren't open for this kind of procedure. We're incredibly grateful that it all went so smoothly.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

author: Elle 123
title: Visiting
body:
My mother age 74 who suffers from Schizophrenia as well as vascular dementia, my mother also doesn't speak any English has been admitted to QEUH ward ARU4 last night with decreased mobility and raised troponin levels. I have been told by several staff members in this ward as well as the nurse specialist for the elderly I can not go and visit and provide care for my mother to whom I am a full-time carer and also having Guardianship order. Staff in this ward report this is due to Covid- 19 restrictions and that they are sorry for any distress that this has and may cause both to me and mother. I feel that staff are not well informed of the visiting guidelines as it clearly states in GGC visiting guidelines under the Special Arrangements:  
_Special Arrangements_  
_Special arrangements will be made to accommodate the following essential visitors:_  
_‚Ä¢One birthing partner supporting a woman during hospital visits_  
_‚Ä¢Parents of children who are inpatients or attending an outpatient appointment. Parents must remain with their child at all times_  
_‚Ä¢One person to support someone with a mental health issue such as dementia, a learning disability or autism where not being present would cause the patient to be distressed_  
_‚Ä¢One family member/person for someone receiving end of life care._  
Due to their lack of demonstrated understanding and awareness of the policy, I feel both me and my mother have been treated far from person-centred care. Given my mother's medical history and language barrier, I am extremely anxious leaving her in this ward where she is unable to communicate her own needs. And as a guardian, I was granted the powers by the Court of law to be her voice in these circumstances but I feel I have come across a big barrier that I cant seem to cross despite having guardianship I am being prevented to provide care for my mother and discuss her medical condition with clinicians and make the appropriate decision regarding her medical condition.  
To say that I am frustrated with the lack of care and compassion that has been shown to both of us is an understatement. I feel I have been left with no other choice but to seek advice from the Public Guardian as to why an organisation in question is disregarding/ dismissing Courts order.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: dani136
title: We want an explanation
body: Once again our appointments cancelled and no reasons given by Ayr as usual, shocking. They cant tell the press whats going on with covid, bad. As an outpatient, I feel like they treat me with contempt instead of telling me the truth, covering up is no use to the people of Ayr. We want an explanation as to why we are being treated so badly, ayr hospital needs to inform not hide behind an issue

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: JaniceSue
title: My Op
body:
Wow, if this was TripAdvisor I'd be giving 5 stars +.  
From the start of my experience a few weeks ago, through to my surgery, which ended up more extensive than anticipated and to my care in recovery and on the ward I have nothing but praise for every single person I encountered.  
My surgeon, Ms Julian - matter of factly reassuring, professional, courteous and yet kind and considerate at all times. The admissions team and their happy disposition. Tom and his anesthetics team - proper charmers. And all the guys from catering (Martin and Barbara) to nurses including Verity, Chris, David. And all those whose names I didn't catch or remember - everyone of them treated me with dignity and respect throughout.  
Hospital surgery and stays are never much fun but Treliske and it's staff are one of the best places to be

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Mr F
title: Increase quantity of medication cream
body: My son has eczema and we cream him up to about 5-6 times a day. But the quantity of the medication (epimax isomol gel) is not enough for my son due to the amount of times we cream him a per day. So a increase of quantity will be better.

readBy.name: Homerton University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: shopkeepker
title: My treatment was second to none
body:
I was nervous and apprehensive as my previous appointment with my own GP had been painful, and had made me worry about my referral.  
  
My treatment by the SN on duty, SN Wicks, was second to none. She was very personable, professional, and treated me with the utmost respect. I was put at ease at a time, when lets be honest, it is not the most enjoyable of experiences.  
She should be congratulated and recognised for her duty of care. I hope her line managers pass on to her my comments.  
My thanks.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: ajrbyers
title: My son's ENT consultation
body:
My son has chronic tonsillitis and one occasion it even warranted a trip to the children's unit for treatment. On a regular basis his tonsils swell up so much that they even touch is uvula. In fact he is experiencing this right now.  
After repeated visits to the GP they decided to refer him to NHS Forth Valley ENT. We attended an appointment with Consultant A who asked us to undertake a sleep study, which we did. The study came back okay. We attended a second appointment with Consultant A who, on examination, decided that my son should have is tonsils and adenoids removed and have gromits placed for glue ear. He was placed on a waiting list as an urgent case. We waited. The COVID-19 pandemic hit and all procedures were cancelled. We waited more. Eventually we were told he had a date for his operation. We attended the hospital a couple more times for pre-op and for him to have a COVID-19 test.  
Eventually, hours before we were due to attend the hospital for the operation we were informed that Consultant B (who had never met my son before) had cancelled the operation. Why, we asked, they weren't entirely sure - it turned out that it was because they do not generally operate on kids under three. How was this not caught by the myriad of people we spoke to? Every time we attended we were asked his DoB. And why did Consultant B think they could over-rule the decision Consultant A had made?  
We waited some more. Eventually we were asked to come and see Consultant B to discuss my son's situation. We arrived. Consultant B appeared not to have read anything about my son. They didn't even know that a sleep study had been done. They appeared quite dismissive of Consultant A and informed us it had been "wrong" to schedule the procedure let alone as an urgent case. Consultant B believed the risks outweighed the benefits. I asked if they were aware how much pain this caused my son and would continue to do if nothing was done and was told "this is how I want to manage this". Consultant B told us they wanted to schedule a hearing test and that was the last we heard. Nothing has been done since.

author: Ajaxpc
title: Where to source batteries and tubes
body:
I can't contact the service.  
I feel a bit mystified, and uncertain about where to source batteries and tubes ...

author: EHWN
title: Flu' Vaccination
body:
I am 76 and was treated for cancer all last year (2019). I thought I might be a priority, but have only just received a date to attend Udston Hospital in a week. - at 8pm.  
I can drive but what about those who can't - or can't afford a taxi?  
I'm very perturbed that my partner who is 83 and diabetic has, to date, still not received a letter re. his vaccination.  
I am aware that many younger people have received their vaccination. Can we be assured that, when a Covid treatment is available, the most elderly will be treated first please?

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: composernt65
title: My treatment at the Seamoor Unit
body:
On my first visit to the Seamoor Unit, I underwent a consultation with Dr Brunger, who very quickly put me at my ease. She questioned and examined me very thoroughly and was very patient. She then consulted with Dr Coppell, her superior, who re-examined me and confirmed their suspicions that I may be suffering from low grade Lymphoma.  
They then discussed with me in detail the following steps needed to determine my diagnosis and options for further treatment. Following this consultation I was sent a very prompt appointment for a scan where again the staff were very kind and helpful.  
Four days later one of the nurses from the Seamoor Unit, Pippa, rang me at home to say that I needed to have a biopsy, this was arranged very quickly. During my biopsy I was treated by Sandra, the radiologist, and her nurse Debs who again put me at my ease and I could not have wished for better treatment.  
The following week I visited the Seamoor unit where I was seen by Dr Lufti and Nurse Bowyer. Dr Lufti confirmed the diagnosis that they had prepared me for and advised that they treatment they recommended was Active Monitoring. Nurse Bowyer took myself and my daughter to a separate consulting room to discuss Lymphoma with us. She then gave us some written information to take away. She also gave me her card and told me that I could call her or Nurse Pippa at any time for advice.  
I cannot praise the staff who have been part of my diagnosis process more highly they have been very patient, informative and sensitive at what could have been a traumatic time.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: great everlasting impression
body: I attended Shirley oaks to have a laparoscopy. Initially I was very nervous as I suffer from anxiety. I‚Äôve never met such lovely people, they made me so comfortable and attended all my needs. I can‚Äôt even put into words how happy I am with the care that was provided. I really hope the staff see this. You can tell they really enjoy their job, and I just want to thank them again for being them and being so amazing.

author: Rtd Nurse
title: anticoagulation service GG&CHB
body:
As we are in the midst of Covid 19 and I have been using this excellent service for seven years, Thanks is due.  
Thanks to the appointments office for re-arranging appointments when they clash with other hospital appointments. Special thanks to the superb nurses who seem to be neglected and unsung heroines and hero's. Why are they not valued as other NHS staff? They see many patients a day in clinics and in the patients own home - including those know to be Covid +ve - puting themselves in danger of infection and in doing so all the other patients and their families. Why have none of them been tested for Covid? I was amazed to discover this obvious anomaly?  
The chain of command of this service needs to have this facility made available at least once a week - but I do recognise that it wont stop the nurses from becoming infected but will at least allow them to be in isolation and not infecting others at the earliest possible stage.  
They are dealing with very vulnerable patients some of whom thankfully recognise this and the nurses have changed their practice to keep these people safe and where requested to do so have performed the test via an open window because the patients was scared to let them into their home.  
Please let me know what will be done to increase the safety of these nurses.  
Bugs Bunny

title: Flu vaccine General Appointment Service
body: I have recently had to contact under difficult circumstances. helpful professional fast service. Could not have asked for better

title: Great operation experience
body:
I had a total ankle replacement .From arriving at Barlborough at 6.30am the day of my operation to leaving the following day at 5.30pm I was looked after extremely well.The staff are professional experienced very caring and made me feel confident and relaxed with the procedure I was having.The operating team were great my anaethetist was lovely I had an epidural he kept checking I was ok all the way through my operation which lasted one and a half hours .I could hear my surgeon talking to his colleagues with positive comments during the operation so that made me feel happy it was going well .
The nursing staff looked after me so well and made me laugh quite often which is good for mental health as well as the physical rehabilitation . The food was very good the cleanliness and hygiene excellent and the systems in place for covid stuck to religiously.
I was in a ward with three ladies one lady went home the same day as her knee operation thankfully the other lady stayed a night like me which was lovely as I had someone to talk to and that‚Äôs what we did about everything ! When you are tired after an operation but can‚Äôt settle can‚Äôt read having someone to talk to is the best medicine which I had .
I lost my I pod speakers they got wrapped up in the sheets when my bed was changed (had an accident the epidural affecting bladder control!)and when I told the nurse in the morning at 6am she quickly went to laundry before it was picked up at 6.30 and rummaged through the dirty sheets and found them .I was so grateful wanted to give her a big hug but couldn‚Äôt ....covid ! They are expensive speakers think apple should make bright cases for them instead of white .
Once I have recovered from this procedure I will need my other ankle done and have no worries about having it done at Barlborough . One tip I would say you don‚Äôt need to bring towels in which they tell you to on the literature I stayed in my hospital gown the whole of the stay so you only need clothes you come in with and a few toiletries .As usual I took far too much like you do when you go on holiday !

title: Care
body: At 11.30 am I phoned the practice.After a brief discussion with reception I was advised that a Dr would phone ‚Äòshortly‚Äô. He did as promised and following a photo being sent a diagnosis was made and a remedy prescribed.At 11.45 am  I was sorted.Very well done WPC.

title: Caring
body: After going into early pre term labour at 29 +4 weeks earlier this year, my first baby and such a scary experience, but could have been so much more scary if it wasn't for the care , kindness and professionalism of all the staff in maternity triage and labour ward. I was very ill with sepsis and the staff looked after me and a combination of maternity nurses and doctors effectively saved my life and that of my baby girl, for this I will be eternally grateful. Its taken me 9 months to feel able to write this, which shows how traumatic these events were for me, but through the trauma it still to this day always stands out in my mind how well I was looked after and cared for- thank you !

title: Extra Mile
body: All the staff go the extra mile best GP practice ever. The respect and care I recieved when my husband died was first class.

title: Amazing service
body: I had an urgent issue that only the gp could deal with, when I called in the surgery, the receptionist had provided me the best solution to my matter and had been showing me some care towards me. I really appreciate what the surgery has done for me.

title: Wonderful staff
body:
Attended the department yesterday for colonoscopy and endoscopy, the consultant and nurses were brilliant from start to finish. They put me at ease from the moment I stepped into the department until the moment I left, cannot praise them enough. 
Thank you so much

title: Great
body: When ever I go, I am happy with the service asma gives and gives me full information on what I need. My doctor is the great in ever area I need.

title: Great people to talk to
body: Very helpful and easy to talk to, would definitely recommend to other people struggling with mental health

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

title: Very efficient
body: The flu jab was so quick, easy, safe. Very happy with the service provided. All Covid protocols were adhered to.

title: Excellent and friendly practice
body: A Very nice experience, Dr, nurses and receptionist  very friendly and professional.  Not a long waiting period, actually very fast and the place super clean  and well signed. I feel safe and comfortable during the time I was there.

title: Exceptional service all the time!
body:
I feel writing this review isn't enough to state how brilliant "ALL" the staff are at Ratby surgery.

 From the receptionists being polite, efficient and always helpful! They are the first port of call and matter so much in directing you in the right place and resolving situations, they have done this at ease every single time. 

To the Practise Nurse always being friendly, enthusiastic, informative and thorough as well as making me feel at ease when having to visit for injections and so on!. 

And the Doctors, always being thorough and confident in their practise when they had to decide what they should do next regarding my child when they have been ill and I have been  concerned, my child has allergies and this has never been problem or a burden to the surgery regarding him getting what he needs!

I myself have used the surgery a lot after having my second child and again the Doctors have been brilliant, and will always listen to my concerns and worrys and genuinely care about your health as well as giving me advise to make the decisions I need too. 

You all deserve the recognition for your hard work! You have certainly made my life so much easier knowing I can call and I can trust the surgery to give the care to myself and my family at a high standard. 

Thank you so much.

title: A Fantastic Surgery
body:
I have been under the care of this practice for the past number of years, but none as regular as this year 2020.
I have been treated very well at all levels, from the reception through to the doctors and nurses.  I have never had any issues or worries about the meds or treatment I recieve and I have always been treated with courtesy and dignity by everyone.

I would like to say "Thank you" to you all, what would we do without your service and dedication.

And all of this during the Covid 19 Pandemic as well, Fantastic !!

title: Excellent service
body: I rang the surgery and was told to ring back as lines were full. I rang 10 minutes later and was given a phone appointment that afternoon. The doctor I spoke to was very helpful, gave advice and agreed to refer me for a hospital consultation. I received a letter from the hospital within 2 days. Very pleased with the service. The receptionist at the surgery was also very helpful.  My husband and I have also been to Castle St surgery recently for our flu vaccines and were very pleased with the precautions the surgery is taking re Covid. It all felt very safe and everywhere is spotless. Again the receptionist and nurse were very pleasant and caring. A great surgery.

title: Well run practice
body: We have been with this surgery for 2 years now and the attention and dedication of the staff has been exemplary. The Doctors, nurses and reception staff work hard and are always friendly and approachable. We highly recommend the surgery and feel confident of being cared for and looked after for years to come.

title: Excellent care
body: I am most grateful for the care I received when I attended the Endoscopy Unit for an investigation.  All the staff who dealt with me were pleasant, kind and helpful - all the nurses on the ward and the doctor and theatre staff who carried out the procedure.  I was apprehensive but found the staff reassuring and willing to answer questions.  There is a general atmosphere of quiet efficiency.  Thanks to all concerned.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Amazing service
body: My appointment was well organised under full distancing guidelines.  The Staff helpful and really professional under such difficult circumstances cannot recommend enough this Surgery.  Very lucky be a patient at Sunny Meed.  Staff have always been great.

title: A caring practice
body: My experience this week has reminded me that everything at Putnoe medical centre is very good, from the friendly competent reception team to doctors that take the time to discuss things with you properly and with kindness. You know when we're ill and feel vulnerable, they are exactly what we need. Truly an absolute blessing.

title: Very please with the outcome :)
body: Hiya there, firstly am not from Cornwall I only stay in Cornwall in Newquay at my parents caravan now and then, I currently live in Newton Abbot Devon so my local hospital Is (Torbay hospital). Secondly I visited the Royal Cornwall hospital Treliske eye clinic yesterday 04/11/20 on invite request to see the ophthalmologist on my pervious day at A+E department. From my experience at the ophthalmology unit or EyE and vision unit my appointment session went positively well, all the staff where amazing so want to thank you for looking after me. What I can take from my session with the ophthalmologist that there nothing to worry about with my eye health :) I highly recommend this ophthalmology clinic @ ( RCHT üëç

title: Fantastic care
body: First I would like to thank the doctors and nurses in A & E for their kindness. After several tests and a scan I was admitted to orchard gynaecology ward with acute appendicitis. The care I received was fantastic from the surgeons to the nurses. Everyone was so kind and took the time to explain everything to me. The nurses were very friendly and the care I received from them made me feel safe and less stressed in what was a scary time for me. The staff are hardworking but always made time for a smile. I really cannot praise them enough.

title: Nervous patient
body: I have had both eyes treated for cataracts and the service on both occasions was superb.   I was a very nervous patient but the staff were wonderful.  Thank you so much to all concerned.

title: Thankyou,Great Surgery
body: For the last 4 days now I've been dealing with the Dr and today the practice nurse, yes you have to wait a while to get through to them but that's expected with covid,But once through to reception I'm sorted and put on the list to get a call back.I can honestly say id not change this surgery at all,the phone is busy as there good at what they do and bend over backwards to help from start to finish,in a nut shell there keeping me alive and ill not trust any other surgery.To all the staff stay safe in these hard times.

title: Decline in level of service since merger
body: The receptionist I spoke to last week was very unhelpful and would not make an appointment for a nurse to treat a painful cut to my finger. My husband had to drive me to Shaftesbury twice before I had to be very firm last Monday to make an appointment to see a nurse, which I did on Tuesday. The person who answered the telephone told me the surgery was very busy.  In fact when I attended for my appointment on Tuesday 3rd November  at 3.45 pm the yellow room was empty.  The nurse was absolutely brilliant and this is what stops me from changing to another practice.  The doctors and nurses who are first class.  However it seems that receptionists are instructed to turn away patients.  I don't like the system of, having overcome the first hurdle, having to wait for doctors to ring you back.  This makes it extremely difficult for working people to make appointments.  In all the merger has had a very negative effect on the excellent service I had from Wootton Grove Practice.  I am not leaving my name but I am sure from my details you will find out my identity.  If you wish to discuss this matter further please contact me.

title: Amazing
body:
Had  an amazing experience with 2 wonderful
People , would love to work in one of your clinics . On arriving I was welcomed and reassured putting my mind at ease. On having the procedure , which was a bit uncomfortable the two members of staff talked me through the procedure and talking to me throughout taking my mind of what was happing they were truly amazing

title: Post graduate dental
body: The doctors and nurses are very friendly and always go the extra mile to be helpful, kind, caring and reassuring. My doctor has gone above and beyond her normal working hours to do what she can to help, working days off and coming in especially to care for me. I think Guys Hospital had extraordinary talent doctors and nurses that do such incredibly amazing job to care for us all. I feel very fortunate that we have the NHS and all the dedicated people that work together to make us safe, healthy and keep us in this planet. Thank you to all the doctors and nurses at Guys Hospital.

readBy.name: Guy's and St Thomas' NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good and efficient
body: I always find the staff very helpful in dealing with my problems.they are always willing  to help solve my issues and always and never keep  me waiting to long.sin√ße Corona  hygiene in the practice is always clean when I visit  the surgery and there is never long queas.if there is it is always dealt with quickly

title: Excellent experience
body: I found the staff to be helpful, cheerful and very efficient. I could not have wished for a better result from the procedure. That this was in the middle of the Covid epidemic was all the more impressive.

title: Great practice
body:
Excellent Doctors and staff. Always friendly, helpful, understanding etc etc. 
Have been with them for over 30 years.

title: Well organized clinic.
body:
What I thought was best about the visit was:
The clinic was well organized and CV19 restrictions were made clear on arrival. The clinicians were friendly and efficient, everything was explained in simple terms. Very pleasant and worthwhile visit.
What would have made the visit better was:
Nothing that I can think of.

title: A top service by hard working folks
body: Goodinge Group has come to my rescue and improved my health several times over the last eight years with their sound advice. They also look after my wife and child well when they are ill and the service and scheduling, while not perfect, are pretty darn professional and we trust them, quite literally, with our lives.

title: Wonderful Service
body: I rang the centre because I had a minor wrist injury, I was given an appointment and seen by the nurse on time. She was kind and considerate and dealt with the injury in no time. I can't recommend this place highly enough.

title: First class practice
body:
Very Helpful and efficient in all departments when ever contacted
With any problems or to make appointments

title: Very good practice.
body: Only waited a few minutes the Phlebotomist was lovely and I have no complaints about the surgery all the staff seem to be very happy to help you

title: Cleaning
body:
While I cannot fault the care I received from the staff at The Hurstwood Park Centre for my CT Scan today.
I feel that I must express my concerns about lack of cleaning in place there.
I sat in the waiting room for over an hour had to use the toilet twice ( a number of other people used it too)
Not once did I see a cleaner.
I would have thought that because of the pandamic there would have been a much more through cleaning schedule in place.
Restuarants,Schools ,Dentists etc have a continuing cleaning system in place.
I felt very vulnerable and nervous being there using facilities and sitting on chairs that hadnt been cleaned after each patient.

title: Amazing staff
body: As we have ongoing health concerns with our parent we seem to be in constant contact with the practice.  Despite the extra pressures/workload created by COVID-19, the staff (reception, secretaries and GPs) have spent a lot of time giving excellent advice and support.

title: Not answering phones
body:
Always bramhall medical been very good. 
But since the pandemic you call to get appointments but no body answer. Two days
Call for more than twenty minutes and am in position one but still no body answer. Thanks

title: Excellent safe coordinating of patients...
body: I had my flu injection this morning, met by happy friendly staff,  clearly and safely directed to designated area after taking of my temp and cleaning hands. I was in and out in less than 5 minutes.

title: Excellent!
body: Aside from being the best GP practice I have ever used, I would just like to say how easy and hassle free the flu clinic was on Saturday 17th October. The whole thing was extremely efficient; much more so than previous years. Well done to whoever put this system into place as it made it so much easier to get your flu jab this year. Thank you so much.

title: Highest Praise for Orchard Ward
body: Our daughter will be discharged next week from Orchard Ward, being admitted voluntarily from London as a family we were extremely anxious. This being our daughters first admission and being a 4 hour drive away from home we had so many reservations ,also with all the restrictions due to local lockdown we had no clue how our daughters treatment would look and how visitation would work. I cannot praise highly enough the professionalism of all the staff on Orchard Ward. At first I drove the poor Nursing/HCA staff mad with constant calls and emails but every single member of staff were kind and understanding and would patiently explain everything to me. Yes the ward has rules, they have to protect and keep the adolescents safe, this includes the non use of camera phones ( I don't know about anyone else but I don't want my daughters face on social media whilst in hospital) so yes my daughter didn't have her phone for a week until we took her a brick phone. In the interim she had a detox from social media and the internet which I personally believe is fantastic. If we want to speak on the phone there is a patient phone that the adolescent can use or we can use to call her. She was admitted to heal and receive specialist help and support and has received exactly that. My daughter has accessed her education a talking therapist and music therapy which she has found invaluable. If you want to see what treatment is like from Nurses whom work for pay only and an extremely stretched CAMHS then come to London. I have had to fight like a lion to get just the smallest of help and support here in London with mental health nurses whom come to work for pay only and not in your child's best interest. To witness and receive the care we have from Orchard Ward has been refreshing and a huge relief. I want to say a HUGE thank you to every single member of the team on Orchard ward, from the amazing family therapist whom gave me space and  supported me through a very tough time to the HCA's whom have been with my daughter as a 121 for a period of time and have been kind, helpful and lovely giving my daughter the support that she needed being away from everyone she loves and cares for. To the Nurses whom have communicated so well the care my daughter has been receiving and answering all my many questions with patience and understanding and just loveliness. To the management team on the ward whom have been so wonderful helping us with visits and replying to all of my queries. Finally to her Doctor whom has shown compassion and kindness, communicating with me with regards to treatment and answering all of my concerns and worries. Compassionate, kind, patient, empathetic, lovely.. I know I repeat the words but these staff members deserve this praise and more. Working under these circumstances cannot be easy but from our experience we see a team of staff whom have pulled together to work for the best outcome of our daughter and we cannot thank you all enough.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Coronavirus
body: My husband is due for surgery next week , and we have to have a covid test 2 days prior . There is nothing on the website about where to go or what to do . All I know is that it's "pod 5 " . I can't plan where to go as there is no information , so I'm relying on clear signage , but according to the only message on the website , there is practically no signage , leading to visitors looking for the pods having to ask inside main building ! This is appalling and needs to be sorted . Even a few hand made signs in red ink would be better than nothing . Why has this been ignored ? There are sign makers in every town who would make some up in a couple of hours ! I'm dreading trying to find this pod . At the very least , put clear instructions on your website as to where to go from main road .

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

title: Disappointed by lack of help
body: Hi I am surprised that the practice won't consider doing any blood tests, I asked today as a very high risk patient if they could help by doing an urgent blood test. The only advice was no we can't or don't do any blood test. The only advice was go to the hospital and get it done there. Anyone who has used this service knows that your all cramped in to a small waiting room or stop in the corridor where social distancing is different if not impossible there. As someone with a lung disease that's the last place I should go at this time for my own safety. That's why I was so disappointed by the GP receptionist giving me a flat NO we cannot help without even considering why I was asking for there help with a simple blood test. Very very disappointed by the lack of support. Not good

title: Rude staff
body: Rude staff. Short and abrupt on phone. Cutting me off as I spoke to get me off the line. Wouldn't recommend.

title: Great doctor
body: I have speak to a doctor a few weeks ago and after speaking to 5 doctors she was the only one that could get me mental health due to my son's death am very greatful for this

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Excellent practice
body: Every time I have contacted this surgery I have been treated with respect curtesy and politeness. I have used face to face , telephone and computer contact they have all been polite courteous friendly helpful and caring often more than expected I cannot praise them enough they are a super group of professionals who respect their patients nothing is too much trouble for them 10 out of 10 for communication professionalism confidentiality and efficiency. This practice is brilliant.

title: Thank you!!
body: I have never had a problem trying to get an appointment with a doctor or a nurse. An appointment can be booked by telephone or through the GP app. I want to say ‚Äòthank you‚Äô to everyone at Tower Hill;  for working so hard and under such tremendous pressure during Covid pandemic.  You have all worked relentlessly since March this year! Everyone has always been friendly, helpful and professional.  Thank you so much for looking after me and  please be safe.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

author: CurlyLou
title: A word of appreciation
body:
Staff nurse Mc Keague. Ward B2 AAH  
After a car accident last year I spent 4days on this ward undergoing extensive tests. I was the youngest patient in my bay, 3 elderly ladies and a seriously ill MS patient who had no body control completely dependent on care.  
I watched this nurse, especially , along with her colleagues, treat everyone with respect, care and always gave her time to have a word on top off her normal nursing duties.  
Some people are borne to care for others and this nurse's compassion and care was in abundance.  
I meant to send a one word of appreciation at the time. I hope better late than never will suffice.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: SuperSheikh
title: How therapy changed me for the better
body:
I was depressed and anxious which affected my daily life. I had no motivation to do anything yet I wanted things to change even though I wasn‚Äôt particularly doing anything to change it. I was unable to express my feelings nor did I think I was capable of feeling anything since I felt empty inside.  
Someone close to me suggested I refer myself to therapy but I was hesitant because it‚Äôs frowned upon in my ‚Äòculture‚Äô. Anyway, because of my anxiety, I missed my first appointment and didn‚Äôt feel comfortable talking to a stranger. I felt bad about myself to I rebooked it so in order for me to improve myself.  
My therapist, Rashmeet, called me and introduced herself and I felt comfortable starting therapy with her. We spent the first few sessions discussing how I was feeling and how these problems came to be. The following sessions were about methods of self improvement and with each session, I practised what I was taught in my daily life from challenging negative thoughts to speaking publicly without stuttering as it was affecting my work and home life in a negative manner before.  
I gradually started to use the strategies that I was taught more and more so now I‚Äôm able to use them whenever I feel down or having negative thoughts. In the end, going through therapy with Rashmeet was the smartest thing I‚Äôve ever done.

author: everial b
title: Sons struggles
body:
Son referred by school and GP to community paediatrics in 2019 who have been amazing and very supportive, son put on AAP 18 months ago, also done sensory workshop up in leven was really good, and attended OT at Queen Margaret, all great.  
I am not happy with waiting times in fife for assessments to be done, son still hasn't even been triaged yet, before covid pandemic even started waiting times were ridiculous, from a parents point of view feel like im sitting in a dark tunnel with no light or answers to any questions, its so frustrating not knowing what is going on or how long the waits for assessments are. Why are the children of fife waiting so long to be assessed?

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Maz2003
title: Superb treatment of my daughter
body: I want to say massive thanks for the superb treatment of my daughter at Minor Injuries at Stirling this evening. We were triaged on NHS Near Me, and then attended from beginning to end within 40 minutes including consultation, X-ray and splint. Very efficient service and first rate care. Massive gratitude to the HCP who treated her.

author: festivityqq95
title: For all Staff at B ward
body:
To all you staff of Morriston Hospital at B Ward Orthopaedic  
You looked after us all with your caring professional service  
Nothing to much trouble to provide everything thats needed  
Staff you make the NHS great the way you look after patients  
From morning though to night you cope with all the pressure  
Our thanks to God we have an NHS and we love and bless her  
The demands on NHS services increases for whats desired  
And B Ward staff you fulfil all our expectations you really inspire.  
Being a patient B ward I really received so much help and care  
For the NHS to continue in success it‚Äôs patient experience to share  
The NHS is our foundation and we‚Äôre make sure you‚Äôre always there  
staff as I look out the window in B ward you are my breath of fresh air  
B Ward always busy amongst the hospital activity, hustle and bustle  
And staff always willing to go the extra mile nothing to much trouble  
always so friendly and happy you light B ward up like a lighted candle  
My lovely staff and friends whatever our problems you help and manage  
As I am lying on my hospital bed with your help to make me heal  
I am really being looked after served with a really delicious meal  
The NHS is a partnership with staff and patient an excellent deal  
Oh! just a minute there is nurse treating a wound for me on my heel  
So to all you professional excellent staff who helped me in ward B  
Every patient would speak highly of you all on this they would agree  
I have experienced all you dedication and care that was given to me  
Orthopaedic ward B long may you continue I will keep a happy memory  
To all staff Ward B Orthopaedic

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Mondoxo
title: First colposcopy
body:
After having my first smear I was told I needed to attend an appointment for a Colposcopy. My appointment came through really fast and it was within 3 weeks of receiving my results, I was really happy to not have to wait to long to be seen.  
On the day of my appointment I was feeling very nervous, more about what was going to take place as it is in an intimate area. Immediately the ladies in the room made me feel at ease and made me feel like what was about to happen was very normal (which it is to them). They asked me if I was okay and had any questions before we began, while the procedure was taking place the conversation carried on, again taking my mind off what was happening. I really can't thank the lovely ladies I saw enough for making me feel so comfortable and carrying out a great service.

author: Forfargirl
title: End of life care
body: Dr Wallace from Lour Rd surgery provided care and support to my father in law in his last weeks of life. Not only did she visit and check on him most days, she offered clinical and emotional support to me while I tried to help and advocate for him. Her compassion and genuine care showed no ends and we are so grateful to her for all her attention and for nothing being too much bother - it made a very difficult time that little bit easier.

author: Little Monkey
title: My stay in ward 2
body: I became ill at home and was taken to hospital by an ambulance. I stayed in ward 2 where I had to have some medicine put into my veins.. All the staff on ward 2 was very nice to me and comforted me when I was very upset and scared. They would get me anything I needed nothing was too much trouble this made me feel much better. I had a very painful kidney infection and now getting better. The ward is the best and I will tell all my family and friends about my stay.. Thankyou to the nurses, drs, consultants, and activities man for making me better

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Salsmum
title: Excellent staff
body: As soon as I walked in the lovely ladies put me at my ease. Nicky, Jen and Jess gave me excellent care, informed me at every step what was happening. Very professional and very compassionate. Couldn't of been more reassuring.

author: PJLS
title: left with a happy girl
body: Took my daughter for a dental x-ray. My daughter is autistic with very high levels of anxiety, at the dentist we couldn't even get her in the chair and there was no way x-rays could be done ,hence why we were referred to QEQM hospital. A lady called Alex with red curly hair came in and was so lovely with my daughter, she was calm, didn't try to rush her at all and made her feel at ease, it took some time but eventually got the x-ray that was needed, my daughter hasn't stopped talking about the x-ray lady, she was just wonderful and made such a difference, I left with a happy girl rather than a distressed scared anxious one.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

author: district nurse
title: district nurse service
body:
I am an unpaid carer for a 93 year old friend. He has issues with his bowels and was referred by his son to the district nurse service to be assessed. The first appointment was missed because of a mix-up with addresses so I phoned to reschedule for another day I also contacted them to tell them the gentleman was deaf and could they bring a hearing loop.  
I asked for a specific day as the gentleman benefits from getting out for short periods. I went along early this morning and even phoned to check they had the correct address. I phoned twice to check they were coming and was told they would be and they finish at 4. 30. I even phoned just before 4. 30 and was assured they would be.  
I then received a phone call to say their records showed the consultation was a telephone consultation. I repeated that the gentleman was deaf and with his consent I did a telephone assessment. The only thing they could provide was pads and the gentleman said he would not use them. The conversation ended there but all the waiting was very frustrating for the gentleman.

author: Ps whiskers
title: Absolutely brilliant
body: Had internal bleeding stayed in for five and a half days the staff were absolutely brilliant they're a credit to the nhs

author: pepperbq45
title: Poor care - Ward 10D
body: My elderly relative had recently been discharged from ward 10D in the QUEH in Glasgow following an emergency surgery after breaking her ankle. The overall cleanliness of the ward was very poor, and she even stated that after she was assisted to the toilet using a bed pan that the staff member helping her do so poured the urine down the sink as opposed to disposing of it correctly in the sluice. There was also several times she was left soiled in her own urine because staff members wouldn‚Äôt attend to the buzzer. I wouldn‚Äôt usually complain as I know how stretched the service is, but that‚Äôs 2 family members that have been admitted to this ward and received terrible care.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

author: GW123456
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Journey and Change
body: The IRP course has been so helpful in my recovery Journey. Excellent open and honest talks with the facilitator Aaron and my fellow peers. Taught me that we are only human and to have more self love and compassion. A really useful and enlightening course that was often the highlight of my week.

author: Ja123456
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Anxiety around Group work
body: IRP has been very good for helping my recovery. Being able to connect with people in the same boat as me. Having someone who has been there and seeing how I can change. With the support of my Key Worker and peers. Being able to talk and be honest has had a big impact on me, knowing there is support for me.

author: Ja123456
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Recovery
body: I have really enjoyed the IRP groups, they have been very informative and I have learned a lot from them. I hope to take this knowledge away and apply it in to my new habits. Aaron has been very helpful and a great facilitator of the group. I would also like to thank Harry for referring me to the IRP group.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Felica
title: All staff were so understanding
body:
My Elderly Father with Dementia was admitted through ED in July to Ward C6. Every single person involved in his hospital journey could not have been better! My Father can be agitated due to his dementia and all staff where so understanding of his frustrations and went above and beyond to alleviate his anxiety.  
Our family want to send a heartfelt Thank you to everyone in these departments. Not just the Doctors and Nurses, the Multi disciplinary team, support services staff such as Porters, Domestics, ward clerks, Pantry Staff, Agency Staff who are so often overlooked. You are all working under intense pressures but always remain professional and friendly! Your kindness did not go unnoticed.  
Thank you!

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: Felica
title: Delerium
body:
My Elderly Mother was taken to Causeway Hospital A&E, where she was later admitted to the Coronary Care Unit and later transferred to Medical One.  
While in hospital my Mother took acute confusion which was new and so frightening for her and us.  
Due the current Covid Regulations we where unable to visit her but we took great Comfort in knowing that there was one Health Care Assistant with our Mother at all times. This required them sitting in a side room in full PPE for long periods of time, putting themselves at risk despite their discomfort in order to keep my Mother safe. Modern Day Heroes in our opinion.  
Each and every person we came to encounter during my Mother‚Äôs Hospital Stay was so comforting, staff where so accommodating and nothing was too much bother. We got constant updates and even Phone-calls with senior Medical staff. Countless people rang from their different disciplines and we felt involved and part of the hospital journey even though we couldn‚Äôt physically be there. We want to thank all the Staff of A&E, CCU and Medical 1. You are all amazing and a credit to Causeway Hospital!

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: gilllianann1
title: Neurology
body:
I have waited 5 years to see a neurologist and saw 2 locums before that the last one left me in limbo as she was changing my meds this new consultant seems very nice but no one has heard of him and the switch board would not put me through to the neurologist dpt even though I've seen him, I'm pulling my hair out,  
Why do people have epilepsy don't seem to count unless you can afford to go private

author: pilingspw55
title: What is the visiting process?
body:
I would like to enquire on behalf of the patients when would the opportunity and the chance for visits to proceed in Arnold Lodge. I know at the moment it is very difficult. I understand the pressures on everybody at the moment. Can you let us know in the near future, what is the process? Lets hope it gets back to normal soon. From all patients  
from Thornton Ward

author: pilingspw55
title: Patient Forum
body:
I have been on the patients forum and I have requested by Patrick to write a request for the completion of the exercise machines on the field to be erected and screwed down. If possible in the near future as they are lying there doing nothing getting wet. I will make enquiries on the next patient forum to Patrick to gain more update. I would like to thank you all for reading this.  
from Thornton Ward

author: pilingspw55
title: Thank you to the managers
body:
I would like to thank the managers, especially Mr Coumar for the opportunity for all patients around the hospital for the chance to gain access to takeaways. Everyone on Thornton Ward enjoyed the McDonalds. We are ordering the next one but we haven't made our decision yet. We like this new decision from you all to allow this. I would like to thank you very much.  
from Thornton Ward

author: pilingspw55
title: Outing
body:
Can I please send you this comment and say thank you very much for being giving back about leave and being given the chance to go to Uppingham Road. All patients are happy but could you let us know when Tescos would be recommencing? I will make this a short letter but I would like to thank you all for what we have achieved.  
Thank you very much,  
from Thornton Ward

author: COVID Survivor
title: Referred to Integrated Care Team
body:
In late March 2020 I was admitted to Crosshouse University Hospital with severe COVID 19 and after a protracted term in ICU and other Wards, I was discharged in May 2020. The long process of recovery then started.  
I was told by hospital staff that I'd been referred to NAHSCP (Integrated Care Team) to look after me in the home setting. The day after my discharge from hospital I was visited by members of the North Ayrshire Integrated Care Team, who co-ordinated my recovery. Throughout the period after my discharge I was expertly cared for by a wonderful team of professional Health Care Staff. From Doctor Harvey, Physiotherapist, Occupational Therapist, Dietician, Speech and Language Therapist and Nursing Staff. (sorry if Ive missed anyone out)  
Each of the team made expert co-ordinated visits, either in person of virtually, to deliver what can only be described as the best care package. For someone who could barely walk the length of myself, I was coached back to walking, with the aid of a wheelchair, then walking frame, then walking stick. The support provided allowed me to recover to the place where I'm practically in a position to consider a return to work, in the future.  
Without the support provided, I would still be struggling, even after this period of time.  
No words can be said to thank the team for the dedicated support delivered, but simply said, A VERY BIG THANK YOU to all involved.  
This co-ordinated approach could easily be replicated by other Health and Social Care Partnership in the greater Ayrshire areas, and I would suggest that with a little thought, this service could easily be delivered by both East and South Ayrshire HSCP's.  
Well Done North Ayrshire HSCP.

readBy.name: North Ayrshire Health & Social Care Partnership
Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)
